00072 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00073 
00074 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00075 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00076 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00077 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00078 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00079 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00080 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00081 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00082 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00083 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)
00084 
00085 typedef struct {
00086 
00087     volatile unsigned long lock;
00088 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00089     const char *file;
00090     const char *function;
00091     unsigned line;
00092     int cpu;
00093 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00094 } xnlock_t;
00095 
00096 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00097 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00098 #else
00099 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00100         0,                                      \
00101         NULL,                                   \
00102         0,                                      \
00103         -1                                      \
00104         }
00105 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00106 
00107 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00108 
00109 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00110 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00111 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00112 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00113     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00114 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00115 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00116 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00117 
00118 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00119 
00120     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00121 }
00122 
00123 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00124 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00125 
00126 static inline spl_t
00127 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00128 {
00129     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00130 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00131 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00132 {
00133 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00134     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00135     unsigned long flags;
00136 
00137     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00138 
00139     adeos_load_cpuid();
00140 
00141     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00142         {
00143         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00144             {
00145             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00146 
00147 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00148             if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00149                 {
00150                 adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00151                 printk(KERN_ERR
00152                        "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00153                        "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00154                        "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00155                        lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00156                        lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00157                 show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00158                 for (;;)
00159                     safe_halt();
00160                 }
00161 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00162             }
00163 
00164 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00165         lock->file = file;
00166         lock->function = function;
00167         lock->line = line;
00168         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00169 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00170         }
00171     else
00172         flags |= 2;
00173 
00174     return flags;
00175 }
00176 
00177 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00178 
00179 {
00180     if (!(flags & 2))
00181         {
00182         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00183 
00184         rthal_cli();
00185 
00186         adeos_load_cpuid();
00187 
00188         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00189             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00190         }
00191 
00192     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00193 }
00194 
00195 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00196 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00197 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00198 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00199 
00200 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00201 
00202 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00203 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00204 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00205 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00206 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00207 
00208 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00209 
00210 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00211 
00212 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00213 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00214 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00215 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00216    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00217    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00218    timer interrupt instead. */
00219 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00220 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00221 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00222 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00223 /* Using 3/4 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00224    experimentation that proved to fit on tested x86 platforms with
00225    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00226    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00227    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00228 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 3 / 4)
00229

00231 #define XNARCH_ROOT_STACKSZ   0 /* Only a placeholder -- no stack */

00270 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00271 
00272     /* Kernel mode side */
00273     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00274     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00275     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00276     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00277     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00278 
00279     /* User mode side */
00280     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00281     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00282 
00283     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00284     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00285     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00286 
00287 } xnarchtcb_t;
00288

00294 
00295 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;

00297 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->vector)
00298 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->errcode)
00299 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->regs->eip)

00301 typedef struct xnarch_heapcb {
00302 
00303     atomic_t numaps;    /* # of active user-space mappings. */
00304 
00305     int kmflags;        /* Kernel memory flags (0 if vmalloc()). */
00306 
00307     void *heapbase;     /* Shared heap memory base (possibly unaligned). */
00308 
00309     void *shmbase;      /* Shared memory base (page-aligned). */
00310 
00311 } xnarch_heapcb_t;
00312 
00313 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00314 
00315 {
00316     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00317     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00318     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00319     hcb->shmbase = NULL;
00320 }

00326 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00327     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00328 }
00329 
00330 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00331     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00332 }
00333 
00334 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00335     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00336 }
00337 
00338 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00339     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00340 }

00342 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00343     return adeos_processor_id();
00344 }

00347 
00348     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);

00353     kfree(chunk);

00360 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00361 do { \
00362     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00363     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00364     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00365     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00366 } while(0)

00371 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00372 
00373 {
00374     spl_t s;
00375     splhigh(s);
00376     splexit(!!imask);
00377     return !!s;
00378 }

00380 #ifdef XENO_INTR_MODULE
00381 
00382 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00383                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00384                                                    void *cookie),
00385                                    void *cookie)
00386 {
00387     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00388 
00389     if (!err)
00390         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00391 
00392     return err;
00393 }
00394 
00395 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00396 
00397     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00398 }
00399 
00400 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00401 
00402 {
00403     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00404         return -EINVAL;
00405 
00406     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00407 
00408     return 0;
00409 }
00410 
00411 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00412 
00413 {
00414     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00415         return -EINVAL;
00416 
00417     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00418 
00419     return 0;
00420 }
00421 
00422 static inline void xnarch_isr_chain_irq (unsigned irq) {
00423     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00424 }
00425 
00426 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00427     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00428 }
00429 
00430 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00431 
00432     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00433 }

00436                                                  cpumask_t affinity) {
00437     return adeos_set_irq_affinity(irq,affinity);
00438 }

00440 #endif /* XENO_INTR_MODULE */

00443 
00444 void xnpod_welcome_thread(struct xnthread *);

00447 
00448 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00449 
00450 {
00451 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00452     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00453 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00454     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00455        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00456        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00457        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00458        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00459        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00460     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00461 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00462 }
00463 
00464 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00465                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00466     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00467 }
00468 
00469 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00470 
00471 {
00472     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00473 
00474     adeos_load_cpuid();
00475 
00476     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00477        and always inside a critical section. */
00478     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00479     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00480     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00481     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00482     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00483 }
00484 
00485 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00486     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00487 }
00488 
00489 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00490                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00491                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00492                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00493                                     )
00494 {
00495 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00496 
00497     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00498         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00499         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00500         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00501         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00502         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00503         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00504         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00505         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00506         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00507         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00508         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00509         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00510         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00511         "ret\n\t" \
00512 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00513         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00514         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00515       : /* no output */ \
00516       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00517         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00518         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00519         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00520         "b" (out_tcb), \
00521         "S" (in_tcb), \
00522         "a" (outproc), \
00523         "d" (inproc));
00524 
00525 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00526 
00527     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00528     
00529     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00530         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00531         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00532         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00533         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00534         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00535         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00536         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00537         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00538         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00539         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00540         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00541         "ret\n\t" \
00542 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00543       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00544         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00545         "=S" (esi_out), \
00546         "=D" (edi_out), \
00547         "+a" (outproc), \
00548         "+d" (inproc) \
00549       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00550         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00551         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00552         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00553 
00554 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00555 }
00556 
00557 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00558                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00559 {
00560     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00561     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00562 
00563     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00564         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00565            bit need to be cleared. */
00566         clts();
00567     
00568     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00569 
00570     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00571         {
00572         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00573 
00574         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00575 
00576         if (!inproc->mm)
00577             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00578         }
00579 
00580     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00581 
00582     stts();
00583 }
00584 
00585 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00586                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00587     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00588 }
00589 
00590 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00591     /* Empty */
00592 }
00593 
00594 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00595                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00596                                          const char *name)
00597 {
00598     tcb->user_task = current;
00599     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00600     tcb->esp = 0;
00601     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00602     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00603     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00604 }
00605 
00606 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00607 
00608     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00609     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00610     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00611     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00612     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00613     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00614 }
00615 
00616 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00617                                                int imask,
00618                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00619                                                void *cookie)
00620 {
00621     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00622     stts();
00623     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00624     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00625     entry(cookie);
00626     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00627 }
00628 
00629 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00630                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00631                                        void *cookie,
00632                                        int imask,
00633                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00634                                        char *name)
00635 {
00636     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00637 
00638     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00639     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00640     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00641     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00642     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00643     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00644     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00645     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00646     *--(*psp) = 0;
00647 }
00648 
00649 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00650 
00651 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00652 
00653 {
00654     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00655        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00656 
00657     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00658 
00659     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00660         {
00661         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00662         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00663         }
00664 }
00665 
00666 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00667 
00668 {
00669     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00670         {
00671         clts();
00672 
00673         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00674             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00675         else
00676             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00677         }
00678 }
00679 
00680 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00681 
00682 {
00683     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00684 
00685     if (task)
00686         {
00687         if (!task->used_math)
00688             {
00689             stts();
00690             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00691             }
00692 
00693         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00694            hardware. */
00695         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00696         }
00697 
00698     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00699        user-space or kernel thread. */
00700 
00701     clts();
00702 
00703     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00704         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00705     else
00706         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00707 }
00708 
00709 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00710 
00711 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00712 
00713 {}
00714 
00715 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00716 
00717 {}
00718 
00719 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00720 
00721 {}
00722 
00723 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00724 
00725 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00726 
00727     while (!*flagp)
00728         {
00729         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00730         schedule_timeout(1);
00731         }
00732 }

00734 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP

00736 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00737 
00738     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00739 }
00740 
00741 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00742 
00743 {
00744     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00745                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00746                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00747                                      NULL,
00748                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00749 }
00750 
00751 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00752 
00753 {
00754     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00755                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00756                                      NULL,
00757                                      NULL,
00758                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00759 }
00760 
00761 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00762 
00763 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00764 {
00765     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00766 }
00767 
00768 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00769     
00770 {
00771     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00772     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00773     unsigned long flags;
00774     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00775 
00776     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00777 
00778     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00779        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00780        context. */
00781     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00782                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00783 
00784     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00785     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00786     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00787     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00788 
00789     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00790         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00791     
00792     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00793                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00794 }
00795 
00796 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00797 
00798 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00799 
00800     return 0;
00801 }
00802 
00803 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00804 
00805     return 0;
00806 }
00807 
00808 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00809 
00810     return 0;
00811 }
00812 
00813 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00814 
00815 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00816 
00817 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00818 
00819 {
00820 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00821     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00822        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00823     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00824 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00825 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00826     xnshadow_release_events();
00827 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00828     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00829     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00830     schedule_timeout(50);
00831     xnarch_release_ipi();
00832 }
00833 
00834 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00835 
00836 {
00837     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00838 
00839     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00840         {
00841         spl_t s;
00842         splsync(s);
00843         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00844         splexit(s);
00845         return 1;
00846         }
00847 
00848     return 0;
00849 }
00850 
00851 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00852 
00853 {
00854 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00855     xnshadow_grab_events();
00856 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00857 }
00858 
00859 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00860 
00861 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00862 
00863 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00864                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00865                                            const char *name)
00866 {
00867     struct task_struct *task = current;
00868 
00869     tcb->user_task = task;
00870     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00871     tcb->esp = 0;
00872     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00873     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00874     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00875 }
00876 
00877 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00878 
00879 {
00880     unsigned irq;
00881 
00882     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00883         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00884                              handler,
00885                              NULL,
00886                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00887 }
00888 
00889 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00890 
00891 {
00892     unsigned irq;
00893 
00894     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00895         {
00896         switch (irq)
00897             {
00898 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00899             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00900             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00901             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00902             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00903 
00904                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00905                 continue;
00906 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00907 
00908             default:
00909 
00910                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00911             }
00912         }
00913 }
00914 
00915 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00916 
00917 {
00918     unsigned irq;
00919 
00920     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00921         {
00922         switch (irq)
00923             {
00924 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00925             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00926             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00927             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00928             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00929 
00930                 continue;
00931 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00932 
00933             default:
00934 
00935                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00936             }
00937         }
00938 }
00939 
00940 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00942 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00943 
00944 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00945     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00946        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00947        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. */ 
00948     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00949 }
00950 
00951 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00952     rthal_release_timer();
00953 }
00954 
00955 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00956                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00957                                         unsigned long long defval)
00958 {
00959 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00960     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00961     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00962     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00963 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00964     *shot = defval;
00965     *delivery = defval;
00966 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00967 }
00968 
00969 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00970 
00971 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00972 
00973 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00974 
00975 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00976 
00977 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00978 
00979 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00980 
00981 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00982 {
00983     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00984 
00985     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00986     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00987     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00988 
00989     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00990 }
00991 
00992 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00993 
00994 {
00995     int err = 0;
00996 
00997 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00998     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00999        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01000     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01001 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01002 
01003     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01004 
01005     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01006         return -ENOSYS;
01007 
01008     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01009                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01010                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01011                               NULL,
01012                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01013 
01014     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01015 
01016 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01017     err = xnshadow_mount();
01018 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01019 
01020     if (err)
01021         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01022 
01023     return err;
01024 }
01025 
01026 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01027 
01028 {
01029 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01030     xnshadow_cleanup();
01031 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01032     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01033     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01034 }
01035 
01036 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01037 
01038 #ifdef XENO_TRACES_MODULE
01039 
01040 #include <asm/timex.h>          /* For cpu_khz */
01041 #include <linux/kernel_stat.h>  /* For kstat_irqs */
01042 
01043 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
01044 
01045 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI
01046 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (irq_stat[(cpu)].apic_timer_irqs)
01047 
01048 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01049 
01050 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_8254_IRQ
01051 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01052 
01053 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01054 
01055 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)
01056 
01057 #endif /* XENO_TRACES_MODULE */
